subject: Re: [junit] invokeWithKey
msgSnippet: Thanks, dumpKeys() helped.  But I do not know why the key looks like the following: quad_[Lcom.mydomain.Node;_int_int why it puts [L before com? Leila ...
messageBody:
Thanks,

dumpKeys() helped. But I do not know why the key
looks like the following:

quad_[Lcom.mydomain.Node;_int_int

why it puts [L before com?

Leila



--- Raja Nagendra Kumar <Nagendra.Kumar@...>
wrote:

> Hi!
>
> JUnitX has method dumpKeys() in PrivateTestCase
> class which prints what
> is the name you need provide for each of methods. I
> belive the syntax
> Node[]_int_int may be wrong. dumpKeys() should give
> you the right String.
>
> Regards,
> Nagendra
>
>
> leilakal wrote:
>
> > Hello,
> >
> > To test the following private method:
> >
> > private ArrayList quad(Node[] ns, int a, int
> b){...}
> >
> > I am using junitx:
> >
> > Node[] ns = {n1,n2,n3}
> > Object[] args = {ns, new Integer(0), new
> Integer(5)};
> > ArrayList mcss =
> > (ArrayList)
> invokeWithKey(d,"Node[]_int_int",args );
> > Which does not work since ns is not an object. I
> tried
> > Arrays.asList(ns) which doesn't work either.
> Anyone has any idea
> > how to pass an array of objects (and also an array
> of primitive
> > types) to invokeWithKey?
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Leila
> >
> >
> >
> >
